description:
I think there'll be a day where old donut shops like this cease to exist. As long as donut world survives, I'll help by scarfing down all these glazed ones. 

Walking in to see the piles of pink boxes, millions of coffee pots in the open, and of course the donut display, it was nostalgic. 

There's plenty of seating and it's nice to see people just enjoying their coffee and reading the newspaper. I mean there's just nothing wrong about this joint that you can nit pick. Efficient service and $11.50 for a dozen donuts, it's all fine by me.
author: Tony N.

description:
We don't have big donuts chains in the city, so places like this create donuts mood :)

Donuts are always fresh, variety is fine, although I expected more choice because of the name. This place looks like a bakery from my childhood, getting some sort of nostalgia (it's funny because I haven't spent my childhood in the US). Prices are cheap, and the staff is friendly. They work almost 24h, so you can get there almost any time.
author: Dmytro Z.

description:
WORST MANAGEMENT EVER. DON'T USE THEIR ATM.

Sure, I was in there at 1am, but who isn't? It's the only decent donut shop in the area open at this time.

CASH ONLY, so I tried to get cash from THEIR machine, and it did NOT dispense the cash that was charged to my card. (It already shows in my online banking system.)

I spoke with the ladies there and they insisted that they are only workers, they can't help me, and to call the number listed. (Trying to get a number from them was a whole thing.)

I walked out. I was nearly home when I realized that when I call my bank, it'll be a game of who said what.

I walked back and asked for their names. They made such a fuss. Finally, Lilah gave up her name. I see her all the time because I'm happy to support a local business. I also told her she was not nice when she was trying to brush me off without really helping me. She then admitted that this happened often! (Just woww...)

I tried to order something, and she insisted that they were closing. I asked if she wanted me to shut the door, and she said yes, because they were closing.

Ok--here's the crazy part--call it whatever you want--but I live across the street, right...

No more than two minutes was the door wide open, lights still on as fuhh, and well, I'm too blind rn to see the rest. 

I called them like a psycho mofo, asked for the manager, and guessssss wtf what? Lilah said that she's the manager! I asked who the owner was and she said the shop is in her late bro-in-law's name. I persisted, and she insisted that she's in charge of the shop.

I confessed who I was, and she insisted that she was busy baking. Yoooo. I KNOW when sweet goodness is baking, and I know it doesn't happen here til at least 3am. I can't stand liars, and I'm so disappointed it's the manager of the biz of who I've supported for so long!

I walked out, asked for a hug to make sure things are ok (yah, I'm a hugger, don't judge), and she declined--cuz she "don't like me anyway."

All I could say was, "Ok, I see how it is, I'll remember that."

Long story short--don't try to play me in a game of bs.

I'll let y'all know if I ever get my money back. So glad I didn't ask for the max from that damn machine, or I'd be out at least $200, and the manager wouldn't give a fuhh.
author: jolie L.

description: Best Raisin Bran muffin in San Francisco although as many times as I've been to Tartine, Neighborhood on 3rd Street & other such shops I don't know if they bake a Raisin Bran muffin! How embarrassing! However Donut World's is spicy in a good way. Packed full of raisins!
author: Joshua C.

description:
Donuts! They got them.

Some of the bear claws look like they have been sitting out for awhile though.

Other than that, delicious mom and pop donut shop!
author: Elijah B.

description: If you're just craving for donuts... dude! Come here! So many variety of donuts, donut holes. donuts, donuts! Love how it's cute little family place! There's chairs and tables - I met up my gf here one time and dude... both of us ate like so many donut and had our little coffee ... it was a great and unusual catch up place! Give it a try! MMm!
author: Mindy Y.

description: They didn't have as big of a selection as I hoped for given the name donut world but they did have some good fresh donuts. I had an amazing french cruller and got some doughnut holes to go. They were pretty good as well. Not the best doughnut shop I have ever been to but it was good.
author: Barbara N.

description: Can't say that I'm a donut connoisseur, but oh man, this donut shop out-works the surgical residents at Ucsf! They are open from 4:30 AM to 1:30 AM 7 days a week. On my long long call days, it was such a comfort to come here and grab a donut on my way home as a reward. The staff are always friendly and would give me suggestions about their selection. Very diverse donut selection! And mom and pop shop feel is aways so heartwarming :)
author: Yingna L.

description:
I really wanted to like this donut shop. However, that wasn't the case. I wouldn't say it wasn't the worst donut either. If you really just want to satisfy your craving for donuts, then this will suffice. When I visited the shop, I opted for the classic glazed donut for about a dollar and some change. It was soft, basic, and tasted good. It perhaps could have been a bit more fluffy, melt in your mouth, type of donut, but unfortunately the donut didn't meet that criteria. 

One thing I do want to point out is that it's a mom and pop shop that has long been open for business! Support your local small businesses and make the world a better place.
author: Briana H.

description: I like how this place always seems to be open. It's right by the N Judah line, so if you're ever feeling frustrated about waiting for the bus to come, you can just pop into Donut World for a quick sugar fix. There's some booth seating that faces the street. The interior is in need of some major cleaning- the walls seemed worn down, and I couldn't find any seat where there wasn't some kind of crumb or jelly stuck to the table. The prices are pretty fair and you can easily stock up on some goodies without breaking your wallet. The donuts were delicious, but were overly sugary and really oily.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
Donuts here are A-OK. The #1 perk is that they are open for those earliest mornings or late nights out. They close for only two hours per day, so it might as well be 24 hours. 

Apple fritter is well done, with the right amount of crisp and sweetness. 

Donut holes are super cheap munchies. $4 for two-dozen donut holes. Talk about bang for your buck.

The dough is always soft for any of their donuts. They have a good assortment of the classic donut flavors and there are also huge cinnamon rolls. Luckily, I haven't had anything old tasting here and quality has been pleasant.

The workers can be to the point at times when ordering. I don't blame them and I hope they have enough sleep.
author: Jaime F.

description: Amazing donuts at a great price! Only negative is that there isn't one closer to my apartment
author: Clarissa L.

description: Do NOT get late-night donuts at this donut shop. My maple glazed, topped with peanuts, cake donut tasted like curry. What gives?  Now I have to find a real donut shop.
author: Janice K.

description:
Cheap donuts in the inner sunset! 

Went here around ~11 pm as there aren't many dessert places open at that time of night. The donuts are made in house and are extremely satisfying! 

My friend and I got a dozen donut holes and an plain old fashioned for less than $4! They have a credit card minimum so bring cash unless you're planning on buying a ton of donuts lol. 

Good value dessert! Would come again. 

Street parking after 10 PM is easy peasy in the area, wish I can say the same for day time :/
author: Stefanie S.

description: Meh, Ive had better.  With a name like Donut World  I thought i'd be more impressed.
author: M M.

description:
Donut World....nah..more like a donut shop!

When you give yourself the name "Donut World" you had better have a world of donuts all the time, right! Well, that was not the case when I came in. 

I walked in around noon time on a Thursday and this Donut World was looking more like a depleted WORLD.

I was able to pick out a few donuts that I liked but the selection was bare to say the least. Based on the name of the place I was expecting donuts that would possibly out of this world. Actually, "Out of this World Donuts", does have a nice ring to you it! Anyway, I was disappointed at what choices I had to choose from. Also, this place was not very clean either. 

The lady that helped me was very friendly so I cannot knock on to the customer service but the product was not on par with the expectation of some quality donuts. From my experience today, I would call this place "Bare bottom donuts". That name is more fitting for this place based on what I encountered. 

My recommendation is this, fill up on donuts so that there is an ample amount throughout the day for customers to choose from. MORE DONUTS MEANS MORE BUSINESS! 

Oh yeah, splash some paint on this place. It feels a bit old and out of date. If you have to close to remodel then so be it, people will understand. Come on Jack, get with the times. 

I"m out.......
author: Robert F.

description:
Love, love, love this place.  It's friendly, old fashioned and the traditional donut selection is satisfying. (For those watching their sugar intake, Donut World also makes fresh sandwiches to order.)   

So nice that this place is family run and non-corporate. Over the years we've seen the proprietor consistently display a calm, patient and genuinely friendly demeanor to EVERYONE, even the occasional contentious irascible visitor. 

IN SUMMARY: 
  Hours: extensive
    Prices: fair 
     Coffee: fresh and strong
        Donuts: traditional, yummy & made on site
          Service: friendly, patient and attentive.

LONG LIVE DONUT WORLD!
author: Myee F.

description: Delicious donuts, that are always fresh, and so cheap! This is a proper, old school donut and coffee place that's as good as it gets.
author: Maya G.

description:
After not being able to get a jelly filled donut at Bob's yesterday on Polk I went in here pleased to see two kinds of jelly donuts on display: Lemon and Raspberry.

I asked if they have my favorite: Custard filled with chocolate on top. The guy behind the counter said no but he said he could fill a chocolate bar for me. He did and $2 later I had the small bag that he expertly sealed by folding the top a bunch of times - very securly... that donut was going nowhere.

I suppose since I saw no jelly donuts at Bobs the night before I came to really appreciate these here and so I grabbed another raspberry filled with glaze on top.

You can really judge a donut shop on their jelly filled donuts. You can see the quality of the jelly they use to help you feel out overall quality. Here the jelly and the custard was fine.

They went down quick - but keep in mind I like sugar. Great selection here. A beautiful store on a corner with lots of windows and a solid donut toward the end of the night still tasted fresh enough. Next door is a dinner spot. Here makes a great dessert spot.

Bobs: where are your jelly donuts?!
author: Stefan T.

description: The donuts here are way too over priced. The place however is clean and spacious.
author: Deb K.

description: Best donuts my man and I have ever had! Quality definitely is worth the price. Will be getting a 12 or 24 pack next time to take home and share with family!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
While in SF, I was craving donuts, and I was in the area so I searched up a place and found donut world. 
I bought 5 donut holes and they gave me 6 :). The donut holes were nothing special, but they were yummy. 
I also bought an apple fritter, which was split among my friends. The apple fritter wasn't overly sweet or greasy. It was soft on the inside, and a bit crunchy on the outside.
author: Lizzie H.

description:
Artisan donuts these are not. No crème brûlée, no cronuts, nothing topped with bacon or flavored with ube.

But if your cravings run traditional - buttermilk bar, apple fritter, maple old fashioned - you'll be very happy with the offerings at Donut World. Donuts here are not only delicious but also very decently priced and you can get them any time of the day or night since this shop is open 24/7!
author: Miriam W.

description: Best donuts! Made fresh on site daily! Always soft and fresh with quality fillings. Clean space and polite staff.
author: Tristan J.

description: Fresh donuts!  I am a nut about jelly donuts and they don't disappoint!  Friendly and so clean!  I will be back!
author: Barb L.

description: There old-fashioned glazed donuts are my kryptonite. I also like coming here for the croissant sandwiches with bacon and everything I love on them a much better choice then going to Subway just as satisfying but I don't feel like a pig after. Friendly service all day!
author: Everette R.

description: Great variety of old fashioned, cake, and raised donuts!
author: Andy B.

description: Visited Donut World since it was conveniently located at the corner of where we were staying. Went in around 1030 am and almost everything was gone, they had a long ways to go before closing so I wondered if they were planning on putting more donuts out? I ended up with donut holes, bear claw and a cinnamon roll. Overall they were ok but nothing out of the ordinary, definitely satisfied my sweet tooth though.
author: Jessica L.

description: It is exactly what you expect, a cheap donut place with decent donuts. Visited on a Saturday around 10am and still had a good selection of donuts, which tasted fresh since they were made in store. I thought the donut hole was lighter than my chocolate glazed donut but still good. Would go back if I was in the area but not worth a special trip.
author: Jen L.

description: Fantastic donuts, good drip coffee, mediocre cappuccinos. Also this place is open LATE. However, it can have a depressing feel during the day and especially at night. I hope they spruce up the decor sometime!
author: Mikey J.

description: Donut world is great! My favorite are definitely the raised donuts - so soft and fluffy all the time, they're addicting. I'm glad this place has been around so long; it's nice to have somewhere in the area that's open at all times where you can hang out and get a snack.
author: Delia Z.

description:
I bumped into this place while we were walking around after lunch. They have a good amount of choices, such as raspberry donut holes. I got a few donut holes only as dessert because I just cannot resist donuts; they are just the most delicious creations in American breakfast and dessert history. 
The prices were unbelievably cheap and I'll come back here again when I crave donuts on a random day. I believe they open 24/7 too, it's amazing. Bob's is great but the line deters me away, so this is a great alternative close by.
author: Alice S.

description:
Love this doughnut shop. It's right at our stop off the N Judah line. We were here for the weekend visiting family and we had a doughnut each day as our snack. They have an amazing selection and very fresh. I had the crueler the first day and I was hooked. I had 4 cruelers in 3 days. Affordable doughnuts, fast and friendly. 

Very light and not greasy. Glad I don't live here - otherwise, I would probably need an intervention.
author: Monica A.

description: The Chinese lady that help me was super sweet and was joking around with me but they don't have green monsters which I love and had blue ones besides that.. the donuts are so good
author: Zoe F.

description: Seeing the sign outside donut world, I thought "oh wow there's gonna be all sorts of variety." There wasn't.. I was disappointed.. Walked in and walked out. Craving a donut real bad one day, I decided to go back and give it a try. THANK GOD I DID! Best I've have ever had! Big and fluffy and not too sweet! Better to have quality over quantity. I'm so in love with these donuts.
author: Stephanie G.

description: I've passed Donut World every morning on the way to work since I moved to SF, but I'm not the type to buy donuts on my own, so I never gave it more than a passing glance. But, I went in today to buy a dozen donuts for our research group, and was pleasantly surprised by the variety and price! At $10.50 per dozen, they are quite affordable - and their donuts are all very fresh. The variety was so vast, I bought a dozen different types, and easily could have bought another dozen without repeating flavors. They sell cake, yeasted and old fashioned, so whatever camp you're in where fried hunks of sugared dough are concerned (I'm all for team yeasted), Donut World has you covered! Service was really friendly as well! There's really no reason not to try it.
author: Lauren C.

description: I seriously can always count on this place. I'm such a donut girl, I always crave a sweet treat around bedtime. Their chocolate donut is so chocolaty, the dough is just right. Their donut holes aren't oil sponges like most places, they are crispy and soft in the middle with the right texture. Don't forget to grab the huge cinnamon roll. Try this place! Plus  the people there are so nice. Few tips are: CASH ONLY and regular donuts now are $1.10 each:/
author: Camille B.

description:
Still my favorite spot to get an apple fritter! I bought half dozen before leaving for a 5 day trip to Tahoe. 
The raspberry donut holes were pretty good too!
author: PreciousSwt P.

description: I have eaten at this place SOOOOO many times late at night, especially when nothing is open. I am sad to say that this place IS NOT open 24/7 anymore! My friend and I walked up knowing that I could always rely on this place being open. Sooooooooooo sad. Still great donuts--- closes down from 2:30am-4:30am.
author: Julia D.

description: 24 hours and the donut selection is pretty good. Apple fritter done correctly is heaven, and it used to be good all the time here. Unfortunately the last one I had didn't have any apple. What?
author: James C.

description:
We meet again Donut World.

I have been dreaming about Cinnamon Rolls as of late.

The big luscious ones that Cinnabon has perfected.

Hot, gooey, doughy, and ridiculously bad for you.

No place in the city seems to have them. They have attempts at Cinnamon Rolls - but they end up falling short. Too dry. Not the right frosting. Not enough love.

And so - with Cinnamon Rolls on my mind - I decided that the next best thing would have to do - a big Apple Fritter from Donut World.

I stopped in here on a glorious sunny San Francisco day and I ordered one big Apple Fritter and I requested to have it microwaved.

Warm and heavy it was handed to me. And all for under $2.00. Where else can you get an exceptional dessert for that price in the city?

That Apple Fritter was divine. Laced with cinnamon and chunks of apple - it was one of the best desserts that I have indulged in for months. 

I have to make my Apple Fritter's a bi-yearly thing - but if you want an ultimate dessert look no further than the beautiful fritter at Donut World.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
"open at 4:30AM"
goes at 4:35AM. waits 15 mins. calls phone. won't answer. left. never coming back.
author: Aldrich A.

description:
Not the biggest selection but what they have is fresh and made daily. Jelly donut holes, chocolate glazed and jelly filled were the selection I chose and enjoyed them all.

Check them out but don't forget to bring cash.
author: Jason N.

description: I freaking love this place. The only donut shop in San Francisco (that I know of) that consistently has french crullers allllll the time. Soft, moist, not overly sweet. A little greasy, but how would it be a donut if it wasn't. They have it in regular sugar glaze, chocolate, maple, and vanilla. My go-to place for french crullers.
author: Cindy K.

description:
I lived in San Francisco for a year and went here once. I remember getting donut holes and some maple bars one fine sunny afternoon. I sat right in front of the window and people watched. It was an amazing experience. It has been 4 years since then yet this place always seems to come up in conversations about the best donuts. I love how most of my friends who also lived in San Francisco agree. I will come back for you, donut world. 

PS, way better than Krispy Kreme.  Just saying.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: YUMMMMM delicious thick soft chewy donuts. Chewy? Can they be? Not really sure but they are (in a destiny's child way) SO SO SO SO GOOD! One of the best donuts I've ever had. The only negative is that they're cash only.
author: Kylie L.

description: I like that Donut World is open 24 hours but I would like it a lot more if there were actually decent donuts available no matter the time. We came here once just shy of 10PM and pretty much everything was gone. The prices are cheap but the donuts themselves aren't too fresh tasting (although this may depend on luck and what time of the day you come here). If you want really amazing donuts in the Sunset, I recommend Twisted on Noriega (between 19th & 20th).
author: Tiffany H.

description: Each of the staff members has made this shop feel inviting and cozy. I love stopping in for some apple cinnamon tea and a plain donut.
author: Angela F.

description:
It looked like they had just baked a fresh batch of every kind of donut imaginable. The donuts were a bit pricey at almost a dollar each. I remember when I was younger that donuts used to cost 50 cents. Like the price of gas, it went up a lot. They also serve juices and drinks, but I was not able to try them this time around.  

The atmosphere looked a bit dated, but it has a classical timelessness because it looks like they've been around for at least 50 years judging by the furniture. There were tables and chairs available all by the windows. It's also very close to public transportation so it's very accessible. It's also close to Golden Gate park, shopping and other dining areas if you plan to stay around the area for a couple hours. Also, the employee at the store was really nice & I'll know I'll be back to try some other kinds of donuts.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Stopped in here early one Friday morning and was impressed with the variety of donuts they had. I got an assorted dozen and honestly they were all pretty good (because of course I had to try them all). 

Conveniently located on the N line, with quick service for a quick pit stop to then be on your way. 

Plus, open 24 hours, yes please always down for a donut.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
I haven't found a regular donut shop I can give a high score to, because their variety on raised donuts is lacking. No white icing, no cherry icing, no cinnamon-sugar, etc. I'm not a cake donut person, I'm all about traditional raised donuts.

But, their glazed and chocolate iced donuts were good. Still not a Shipley's though (chain in Houston).
author: Michael B.

description: Can you give 0 stars, don't ever try and pay with change, the owner (or his son) assaulted me when I tried to pay with change, when another customer offered a dollar bill for my change the person behind theregister continued to push me out and say "no change, no change" and then pushed me out the door...0 for fantastic service, what an asshole
author: Foodie S.

description: Stopped in after a visit to the farmers market and were pleasantly surprised. We had some donut holes, a chocolate cake donut and a glazed donut w chocolate frosting. All of them were deciduous, fresh and soft!  And only $3!!  We will definitely be returning.
author: wendy w.

description: I love this place! Some of my favorite donuts in the city and great prices. Get the apple fritter. It's the bomb.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I came here three weeks ago right after I visited my dentist and was surprised at the selection they still had at 2pm. With the donut places near my house they barely have any fresh donuts out at 2, but this place was fully stocked with deliciously smelling fresh donuts. There was plenty of seating inside, but I opted to get it to go and enjoy the tasty sweet treats on the ride home.

This place knows how to make donuts. This place knows how to make an old school donut taste fresh. The french crullers was the best I've ever had in my entire life. So light, airy, soft, and perfectly baked (meaning no doughy bits inside). It literally melted in my mouth and the icing on top was heavenly.

I also got a bran muffin and that too blew me away. Bran muffins can be easy to mess up because too many times people make it wrong and it gets super dense. This was not the case. It was perfectly baked and the bran muffin took me back to fond memories of what else, all the great bran muffins that rocked my childhood.

I've made it my mission to come back here every time I come to see my dentist and stock up on all the donuts that I can afford and treat myself for the rest of the week.

Such an enjoyable donut experience. Best one I've ever had!
author: Candice S.

description: My favorite apple fritter in the whole wide world. Why, oh why do you have to be so close?  I haven't tried their other donuts but I'll probably be getting the apple fritter until I get sick of it in half a year. I've only been around night time and it's usually pretty empty in there. It doesn't look like they have everything at this time but they haven't been out of apple fritter yet.  Get yours soon!
author: Irene C.

description:
Most convenient location award goes to Donut World. Perfect little shop to grab a sweet bite if you're getting on or off the N line on Judah/9th street! They're open until 2:30 AM every night and open again at 4:30 AM in the morning (or night... if you're staying up that late to study, Netlflix, game, etc).

This place has single-handedly turned me on to jelly filled donuts. I love that they have jelly filled donut holes! They are so cute and tiny and TO DIE FOR. After reading previous reviews for this shop, my expectations were relatively high. And yes, they were absolutely met! Although I've come here an embarrassing amount of times, I actually have yet to try their other selections (solely because their donut holes/jelly filled donut holes are just that good and I can't NOT order them whenever I walk in), so I can't speak to all the other options they have. Their donut holes however are always fresh, not overly sweet, perfect glaze on the outside, and filled with the perfect amount of jelly.

Very cheap, very delicious, I donut know (I think I'm hilarious) what more you could ask for.
author: Deanna C.

description: Fresh, delicious, and the right price. Plus the folks behind the counter are very friendly. Incredible that it's often open 24 hours too-- that's hard to find in SF!
author: Jared S.

description:
Filled doughnut holes: raspberry or custard!
They fill them after you order them.
For anyone who is likes balance, filled doughnut holes are the best!
author: Angel L.

description:
Donut World might appear like your average open-late donut shop. but I assure you, it's very tasty as well.

The donuts are fresh and the woman behind the counter is very happy to be working there, despite it being midnight on a Monday. She seems like her whole world is literally donuts, and she loves it.

Sure, you have your usual sketchy clientele. Some might seek shelter in the corner of this little world and take the slightest nap. Wouldn't you take a nap in a donut shop if you could? That's the world I want to live in.
author: Sam D.

description: Nice friendly, local donut shop! The staff is very friendly and remembers the folks that come by. I've only went there a couple of time in the past couple of months, but they still remember me. Although something small its nice to be remembered by the folks there. Great donuts and i love their ham and cheese croissant.
author: Sunny P.

description:
Donut World is a 24 hour dispensary of donuts and peerless coffee. for whatever reason, they just advertise 7 flavors of coffee, not peerless.

coffee: peerless, 7 kinds in brewing pots.

eats: 
-glaced: (.90)
airy, sweet donut
-french cruellar(1.15)
mushy innards, sweet outside 
-3.5 stars 

crumbs:
-more seating here than usual in donut places
-24 hours
-fast, friendly, efficient service.
author: Victor G.

description:
CASH-only. I wouldn't call myself a donut connoisseur, but I haven't found anything from Donut World that has stood out to me. I've been a frequent here more so because they're open 24 hours. Often times, they're not very good at keeping their racks on stock either.. so options are usually limited. /=

If anything's worth it, I do like their custard and raspberry-filled donut holes!

So unless you're having a late-night donut craving (which I often do) in the Sunset, hit up trusty Uncle Benny's instead on 22nd & Irving.
author: Andrew T.

description:
As a French tourist, I'm usually pretty picky about food, and desserts particularly. Donuts aren't at the top of my sweets list, but this little store delivered!

I had the old fashioned donut and ate it while walking down the streets of the Sunset district, and it was simply perfect! The donut looked great, its texture was crunchy on the outside and chewy on the inside,it was fresh, had a lot of flavor.

A very pleasant experience, give it a try!
author: Julien N.

description:
Well-priced, delicious donuts. What more can I say?

The atmosphere feels Seinfeld-esque. It's not a place for you to catch up with a friend (unless it's late at night). That's okay because you're not going to be here for long.  Just grab a few old fashion donuts and be on your way.
author: Kevin C.

description: Cheap donuts that are always fresh and delicious! Very standard flavors so don't expect anything fancy. Also, I'd knock half a start off for ambiance because this a place you want to drop in and get out of. Basically, just go there to pick up a donut or some donut holes and you'll leave a happy camper.
author: Eileen W.

description: A good local place to get my fix of donuts anyway of the week. I really like their glazed donuts and donut holes because they are not overly sweet. Dough is fluffy and not too dense with the exact amount of glaze on the top. They taste good either straight from the counter or microwaved for 7 seconds. Lady behind the counter is really sweet and accommodates your orders nicely. I usually come here for a late night snack or an early morning breakfast. Tastes so good with a cold cup of milk and a hungry appetite!
author: Jessica E.

description:
I had been thinking of donuts all week as I haven't had one in many months.  On the way home from Sacto, I asked Hubby to stop off at DW.  I used to live only 3 blocks away and didn't eat much donuts back then, otherwise, I'd be one of the Butt Sisters by now.  Krispy Kreme donuts are OK but they're so fluffy that you don't feel sustained.

I got 3 choc glazed, 1 maple glazed, 1 coconut cake and 1 choc peanut covered cake donuts, all for a mere $4.75.  Try to beat that price, Krispy Kreme!
Hubby doesn't like cake donuts but these are fairly light and not too heavy. I thought there was too much sugar in the glaze/coconut compared to the maple glaze which was pretty fluffy tasting.  Sadly, the peanuts on the choc cake one were a bit off, not fresh tasting. 
There was a fly on the case and I thought it was on the outside but when I tapped the case, it was flew around inside.  They should get doors for the case, the idea of a fly with legs dotted with feces from the dog poop in the streets now resting on my donuts is not appetizing.
author: Ry T.

description:
Justin A. was lucky in his quest for a maple filled bar.  Me?  Not so lucky.  Was I supposed to give a special wink?  Or code word?  Or maybe even extend my hand for a secret handshake?  The guy at the counter just shook his head and laughed - my request for a maple filled maple bar just was not possible.  Fine, ok, I understand and won't dock you stars for this; I'll take two old fashioned maples instead.

Let me remind you that I am not docking stars from Donut World for not fulfilling my maple request.  I am docking Donut World, however, for underdelivering on my favorite donut.

I love maple old fashioned.  I love the sickly sweet maple and the crunchy dough.  Donut World's maple old fashioned, though crunchy, was not rich in maple.  The color of the maple itself, almost like a light khaki, should have already been a red flag, but I must have just been blinded by my donut craving.  Also, the maple had a citrus hint, of which I was vehemently not a fan.  Wholly disappointed. 

I'm sticking to Bob's Donuts.  And when I'm too lazy to haul my arse over to Polk, I'm sure even a Safeway maple old fashioned will do.  Donut World?  Sadly, not so much.
author: Mel T.

description:
My daughter recently had a dental appliance put in her little 10 year old mouth, which can make some foods difficult for her to eat.

Somehow, she manages these donuts just fine, thank you very much.

A great donut shop that reminds me of the kind I went to when I was a kid.
author: Meg W.

description: No longer 24hr, but they still have the sprinkle donuts i like and the oh-so sweet hot chocolate i crave. Yum!!!
author: Sochea P.

description:
Donut world is good. Their donuts are perfectly made whether it be the way it is glazed or being cooked perfectly. The ones i had were delicious and the staff is nice. The only reason why its 3 and not like a 4 or 5 is because theres nothing outstanding about the place that would make me travel all the way to SF for.

Cash only.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
My girlfriend is a bona fide donut fanatic.  She puts the "nut" in donut.  Her favorites include all of them.  She often tells me she wishes I was rounder, with a hole in the middle, and covered in sprinkles and then she gets a horrifying look on her face and starts to lick her chops.  Whenever she gets this look, I make sure to take her to donut world ASAP so she can get her fix!  

She loves the donut holes, apple fritters, old fashion maple, crumb and glazed ones.  I get my milk on seeing as I'm very much lactose tolerant.  I tolerate all religions, races, and lactose.  DW (what cool milk drinking hipsters like myself call Donut World) is a great place to grab a d.
author: Cody G.

description: We had coffees here every morning during our stay in San Francisco. We also got their cream filled doghnut, custard-filled eclair, cheese danish and a round pastry filled with custard (our favorite). They have multiple flavors of coffee and pastries taste very fresh. If you are stating in Inner Sunset and are looking for a to-go coffee or a carb-fix, this is a good place to visit.
author: Darya C.

description:
Donuts: a nice sugary breakfast, a wonderful mid-afternoon treat, or an awesome midnight snack.

Donuts are so versatile and Donut World, being open 24 hours, does donuts right. 

They offer plain donut holes, as well as custard and jelly filled (which are absolutely delicious; 40 cents each or $2 for 6).

Donut World sells regular donuts for 90 cents each and specialty donuts are just a little bit more. Their donuts are always fresh and they always have a plentiful stock. They also have other baked goods such as danishes or croissants, although I've never tried them because I always have my mind set on donuts. 

Notes: 
-There is plenty of seating inside. 
-The workers are friendly. I've paid using loose change many times and they never seem to mind. 
-Parking in the area is usually manageable; you might have to look a couple blocks away though.
author: Samantha L.

description:
FIVE STARS! Pretty much for the fact that I can always rely on Donut World to have delicious yummy fried treats 24/7, particularly when it's late and the hubs and I are drunk, hehe. I usually get chocolate, sugar or glazed donusts or the twists. Awww yeah.

"...and that's all I have to say about that."
author: Lauren L.

description:
I gave in to a donut after 12 years of not eating it. UGH!!!

Traditional styled Chocolate covered donut. TASTED SO GOOD at 330am.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Prior to my recent infatuation with Bob's Donuts, this was my go-to donut shop in San Francisco.  It's conveniently located near two of the Muni bus stops that I frequent most.

They're always open which means if Muni is late (all the time!) I can run in and grab a snack and run right back out.  The selection is very good during daytime hours but quite limited at night.  They have lots of seating inside which can be helpful on those very cold nights.  On certain nights when the NextMuni GPS signs alert me of a lengthy delay, I'd go in and purchase a cup of hot tea or hot chocolate and relax with a donut.  The staff is always very friendly.  They have cold beverages, sodas and dairy products also.

There are a couple of favorites here that I haven't found at Bob's or enjoy more from Donut World.  My favorite is the vanilla glazed raised donut (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4nKCA1XhcT7E_jqlOKxm-g?select=GWLfYA8BTAUA0PD49HpL2Q) which is sweeter than a regular glazed donut with less glaze and a slight vanilla flavor.  I also like their lemon-filled jelly donut (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4nKCA1XhcT7E_jqlOKxm-g?select=_J4HlrHGFVs-W4EHuKTPGQ) because more often than not they squeeze more filling into the donut than Bob's.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Mad world.

When Gary Jules sings: www.youtube.com/watch?v=4N3N1MlvVc4

When yours truly has a donut.

Not a normal occurrence. More like three times a year after an epic night of dancing.

Or after Bay To Breakers. After running over seven miles felt I deserved a fried circle of dough with cinnamon on top.

It was good (as most fried doughy things are).

It was only a buck.

It will rarely happen again.
author: Jason B.

description: I don't come here too often, since donuts are nothing but deep fried dough covered with sugar. There's nothing healthy about it, but when I really crave one, Donut World is always open for my convenience. And surprisingly, their donuts are very fresh every time I stop by. They have a larger variety to choose from during the daytime than during nighttime. Very reasonable prices and friendly service!
author: Priscilla W.

description:
DONUT SPAZ!!!
(4 stars)

Irresistably delicious. Nothing can get me fat because i'm naturally thin and of small stature but these donuts on the otherhand MAY DO THE TRICK. Before heading to Golden Gate park for walks or concerts, I like to dip into here to grab some donuts for my snack sessions.

- taste, droolicious
- price, dirt cheap
- ambiance, buttcrack whole in the wall

I usually get a couple, okay i'm trying to be humble.... A BAG FULL OF DONUT HOLES for pretty cheap (12 for $1.50). I settled for the regular glazed donut wholes and those were amazing on their own. I have yet tried their custard filled donut holes and i can only imagine how amazing they'll taste. Can't there be a donut world near work... in the FiDi? Just saying.

Will I be back? don't have to ask me. 


JABA APPROVED. Until the next review.....
author: Jane A.

description: Better than Bob's, sorry Bob!  The cinnamon twist, is something special! The staff is friendly and they have breakfast items like eggs, bagels and good coffee. All the donuts look so good, I'm gonna try one of each, bucket list baby!
author: Kenneth P.

description:
I went to this place at around 4:30 Am as I work graveyard and get off around 4 AM. The place was still making donuts at the time and the people in there seemed to be in a depressed mood (as places can be late at night /early in the morning). 

But the cashier was nice and even though there selection (at the time) was small the donuts I got were great. The old fashioned able donut had a great fluffy inner texture with a crispy outside and really good and smooth tasting glaze. The chocolate donut was also good with a firm feel but a nice and chewy inside. No crumbly like some badly baked donuts can be.
author: Jack S.

description: Late night craving for something sweet this is one of my spots. They used to be 24 hours, but now they are open until 2am weekdays and weekends 24hrs....unless that has changed. Regardless, if I need a doughnut I go here. Their old fashioned glazed doughnut is my favorite. Also, they can fill any doughnut with custard right then and there. You will generally see me there at 1am or 6am to get my sweet tooth fix for the week. Prices are fair and their donuts are to die for....well maybe not to die for....that would be dumb....to die for a donut
author: Soroosh A.

description:
I tend to have cravings for a period of time, and then after a while, that craving goes away, which is normal I think.

I've been craving donuts lately. And not in the morning, but late at night after having already eaten dinner. So we looked up donut shops close by and saw this place. The donuts are delicious. Their raised donut made me remember why they are my favorite. It's moist, fluffy and the perfect density. Everything from the cake donuts, to the old fashioned are delicious and everything a donut should be. Prices are .95 cents per donut or 6 for $4.75. We went back twice in a week because they were so good.
author: Kimberly F.

description: Warning: First World SF Problems -  Closed (!) on the occasion of my recent, desperate, 3 AM donut-run. Granted, the discouragingly dark storefront prompted a swift 180 before I could check for any notices - a Bay Area shortage of glaze, perhaps? Regardless, these nocturnal donuts, pastries, and the like are ideal when upon the witching hour.
author: Charles W.

description: Donut, mmmmm....These donuts were worth walkibg six miles for. I had the crumb covered fluffy donut, omg! My fav! So fluffy and yummy. The old fashion chocolate, also one of tge best I've had. Bad bad all bad to have this place so close to me.
author: Karen T.

description:
Excellent stop off on the way to or from work, Their open all hours of the day and night with coffee ready and waiting to accompany your delicious fresh donuts.
I'm a fan, and would definately recommend :)
author: Genni V.

description:
awesome donuts especially the sprinkles!

yum yum and decent price-
author: Hao B.

description: A divine apple fritter!  So glad that in 30 years living in the neighborhood I finally got here. otherwise, I would be 50 pounds heavier than what I am now! I did a taste test with relatives who are also apple fritter fans. hands down, they thought this was the best. fortunately for me, parking is a premium in the area. it won't hurt for me to walk several blocks and back to have another taste.  See you, there?
author: Debbie T.

description:
UM, I strictly come here to buy their MAPLE FRENCH CRULLERS!!! :D

This  donut shop is the reason why I'm nicknamed Croolanda & why my bf sings that song by Mike Posner - Cooler Than Me. But instead he says, "You think you're cruller than me." LOL. I go nuts over this place! 

So, let me tell you the story of how my love for maple french crullers came to be.. In 2009 I used to be in the Inner Sunset area a lot to pick up my bf from work. On his lunch break we used to walk the area and try out the restaurants nearby. This was before I even liked donuts mind you. He takes me into this donut shop and saw this funny shaped donut. I used to always get the maple logs (dunno what its called, the long ones?) and the sugary plain ones. But that day I wanted to try something different. :3 I took my first bite of the cruller and I swear I've never "mMmMmMmmED" so loud! keke. Right then & there I fell in love.

So yup. If you have to know anything about me, I LOVE maple french cruuuulllahhhs! I once asked my bf to buy me a dozen maple french crullers for my birthday instead of a cake. (I'm still waiting..) hehe. *hint *hint.   ;)   

What makes Donut World even more frikkenly awesome is that they are OPEN 24 hrs! Whoo FRIKKEN hooooooo! :D The best time to come here is between 2-3am (only through observation). I think that's when they make new batches?? The donuts seem sooo fresh and sometimes still warm at this time. mm warm donuts ;)

They have enough chairs to hold a lot of people too. Sometimes me, my bf, and friends like to come here late night and order like 10 donuts (I know, my bf is random lol. I like to get 2 maple crullahs and I'm gooooood for the rest of the night) and just chill for an hour or two playing cards and Uno. :)

O crap. I just told all my goodies! Please don't run out whenever I go there! :P
author: April D.

description:
Hands down the best donuts in town!

 Perfect price for the doughy-flaky crust of the donuts. Service is great, a mom and pop shop and it's open 24 hrs. Brought these donuts to my office and people went bonkers over them. Highly recommend for a great value.

Best Choice:
Maple old fashion or glazed old fashion
Glazed French crullers (yummy)
author: Julia K.

description:
I am a fan of their donut holes. It's either deliciously tender in the inside or perfectly crusted on the outside. I could go for some right now.


Service is fantastic!
author: Sweets N.

description: What better way to celebrate Nurse's Week by going to the nearest donut shop and getting a dozen donuts to show how much our nurses (and our allied health team members) are appreciated! I came over to this gem of a shop after working a hard 12 hour night shift. Donut world has that old fashioned goodness that cannot be duplicated by chain stores. Came here for a dozen old fashioned donuts and a warm ham and cheese croissant. You can't find good affordable donuts like donut world. Go to another bakery and they'll charge double of what donut world has to offer AAAAAANNNNNDDD they aren't as good.
author: Jordan C.

description:
The appeal of this place is that it's open 24 hours. I like their friendly service and the coffee is what you would expect. 

There's nothing extravagant about this place but it'll get you your coffee fix and donuts if you'd like.
author: Muhammad U.

description: Best apple fritter EVER. Chunks of apples with the perfect amount of sweetness, glaze, and crunchiness. Never burnt or puny in size. Only $1.85. I think I come here at least twice a month to feed my addiction. Ahh you have stolen my heart, Donut World.
author: Annie S.

description:
Jelly filled donut holes.

NEED I SAY MORE?!
author: Lindsay M.

description: My review is based on first impressions/"glass case appeal". For a place called Donut World, you'd think they'd have some different donut varieties to choose from. They had 2: glazed and chocolate dipped. And they looked lonely and sad so I didn't even order one. Granted it was late morning when I ventured in but really? It was time to make the donuts and that time came and went. I love me some donuts so I know I'll come back earlier in the day to hope that they have a glass case that's full of donuty options.
author: Jeff B.

description:
The donuts are just OK. I've had better. From reading other yelp reviews and tips...jelly filled donut holes and apple friiter was all the rave. I tried both. I didn't care for the donut holes but the apple fritter was DELISH! One of the best I've had. 

I'll be back if I'm in the area.
author: Jo S.

description:
My friend and I are on a 24 hour donut shop tour so this was our second stop. The donuts are pretty decent. I got a maple fritter and half a chocolate donut.

It's a no frills donut shop and they have seven flavours of coffee. The prices are decent. You can't really say much more about a donut shop. The selection was pretty good.
author: Amy J.

description: Besides being very sparse with the apples, I couldn't finish my apple fritter because it was so soggy from absorbing too much oil. So. Very. Sad.
author: Candace C.

description:
I awoke around 5:00, maybe earlier. There was some kind of ruckus going on but I could not tell what was going on, or why. Finally, at 6:00 I got up since any more sleep was out of the question.

Instead of my usual wake up snack of coffee and whole wheat fig bars I decided to treat my self. So, I got dressed and as soon as I was out the front door I saw what all the ruckus was about.

There was a steaming, smashed up car jammed sideways between the train platform and the curb. Next to the mess stood two police officers and a 20 something male. One officer took notes while the other spoke to the 20 something. I was tempted to try to get a picture but then I remembered some municipalities had ordinances against taking photos of cops on the job. So, I decided against it. I took one last look and then walked the two blocks up to the 24/7 donut shop - Donut World

As I sat there drinking my coffee and enjoying my cake donut with crumbles I took a look around to see who I was keeping company with.
Customer # 1 was also sitting at the window counter. He was deeply involved in using some small hand tools and was manipulating something inside of a shallow box.
Customer # 2 sat at the back and was slumped forward in his seat, sound asleep.
Customer # 3 was dressed in a heavy winter coat and wore a heavy wool aviator's cap trimmed with fur. His blond hair spilled out from under his hat and hung in curly strings down to his waist. He sat there quietly and nearly motionless with a hardcover book open in front of him.
When I looked outside and saw the tricycle with it's attached trailer and plastic covered load bulging out on all sides, I wondered who the rig might belong to: Customer # 1, 2 or 3?
author: Mike B.

description:
The first time I saw this place I was like WOW 24 hour DONUTS right next to a bunch of bars!  This is definitely a win,.

I had one of their old fashion donuts before, and I wasn't sold.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing....but THEN the last time I came, I followed some Yelp advice and got the 6 donut holes for 2 dollars with raspberry or CUSTARD filling.  I've never had custard filled donut holes before, and I have to say that it was pretty DAMN good.  

If you get the plain ones, it's 6 for a dollar.  Can't really complain about that...
author: Aly A.

description: My friend and I joked about how this place will still be open even at the end of the world or some zombie apocalypse.  It's a fun place to chill after a night of partying and you feel like letting loose your thoughts.  It's one of those places you're bound to find the craziest of crazies hanging around talking about their wildest stories.  Donuts here are insanely fresh and delicious!
author: Sam K.

description: Small selection, cooked to perfection! Have lived in Seattle, Portland, NYC, Philadelphia, and no other doughnut comes close to the delightfully, airy texture of the raised doughnuts in this shop!
author: alex t.

description:
I had cravings for a donut one night and came across this delicious no-fuss donut shop on the corner of 9th and Judah.  Where can you find a place to full those cravings at 11pm?  oh yes, DONUT WORLD!  They have THE BEST apple fritters and chocolate old fashioned.  I LOVE donuts and this is really my favorite place, hands down.  I can't even think of a place that is in comparison.

CASH ONLY so please come with ur dollars and coins.  I had exactly $1.75 and I got myself a chocolate old-fashioned and 6 donut holes. SCORE!!  

Not exactly the most physically appealing on the exterior or interior but def the place to go when u need a quick sugar fix.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Open 24h?
Yep!
Great old school donuts.  No frills here but they have great prices and the pastry is tasty.
author: Alexander B.

description: First, note that it's a cash-only operation, but there are ATMs nearby (a variety on Irving by 8th Ave) if your pockets are empty. The donuts are tasty, hearty, and addictive, and while I've never visited while the donuts are fresh-and-hot, they're still delicious. A couple dollars and change will make a huge dent in your calorie budget, so don't be put off by the prices. The old-fashioneds are great, and the jelly donuts are generously filled. If you're looking for a meal that will fill you for the day, try the apple fritter!
author: Steve F.

description:
Stop #1 on the north Cali donut tour...  Afternoon visit.  Very good tasting donut.  Substantial..  Hmmmm.. Not really sure I've ever described a donut that way before but thats the way it was  LoL 

The maple frosting on the sour cream donut was good, but I liked the raised glazed better.  Check it out if in the neighborhood.
author: Tad H.

description: Can't go wrong with donuts! Used to come here to study... Quiet..cold temperature to keep you awake...caffeine and sugar and uncomfortable seats..keeps the studying going.
author: Sandra S.

description: Everything from here is delicious! Most importantly is their customer service. It's a family owned business and they are very polite and professional. I will definitely be coming here for my sugar fix. Also 24/7!!!? Can't get better than that!
author: leba g.

description:
OK. So how does 24 x 7 donuts sound?

And mega (Mmm--mm good) apple fritters make any excuse NOT to have a donut craving satiated at 12 midnight complete bull hockey.

So go anytime and don't be fooled by the closed (darkish) look of the place. They are open and ready to take your cash-only and turn it into fried and sugared/powdered/glazed/filled doughy goodness.

Jeez, I think I wanna go back again....
author: Glenn H.

description:
I just moved to SF and I needed a replacement for my late-night donut place in Austin, TX (FYI, it's called Mrs. Johnson's Bakery, you must check it out if you're ever in Austin, TX. They're hours are 7PM-7AM, weird, I know.) 

Well lo and behold there's a 24hour donut shop a stone's throw away from where I live. It's a pretty average looking place with a big sign outside that says 'DONUTS' so it's kind of hard to miss. 

The donuts all look delicious. When we got there (sometime after 9PM) the donuts in the case all had a shiny fresh-from-the-fryer look to them. Alas they were not, however. I'm not sure how they keep them from cracking and looking dull even though they may have been sitting there for a little while.

Nevertheless we bought a glazed twist, an apply fritter, a plain cruller and a buttermilk bar. The glazed twist was ok. The donut is mush more dense than I'm used to. The apple fritter was also ok, but it was much tastier the next day. The cruller was very eggy but light and the buttermilk bar was decadent and moist. 

All-in-all ok. Seems like it's hit-or-miss depending on which donut you get, so caveat emptor.
author: Eric L.

description:
It's alright.

Donuts are nothing special, just an ordinary, a little nicer, donut place in the sunset, that's open 24 hours. The selection is pretty good, and the prices are alright as well. I've been here many times throughout the day, even at night and no matter what time i seem to go in, there are a lot of people. Fancy place i assume? or just the same chinese people who flirt with the cashier? Either way it's a nice little hangout place...if you're a fat guy who loves donuts.
author: Cody A.

description: Just had the old fashion but it was YUM!!! Moist with that crispity cunch of the glazed outer layer. Love it when my favs are done right. I'll be back!
author: Sue W.

description:
LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!! it never disappoints because its open 24 hrs/7 days a week! Their donuts are always fresh and costumer service is excellent. I usually pop in after i get off the N-owl from a crazy night and get a donut and a warmed-up ham and cheese croissant. Its yummylicious. 

They dont except cards only cash:(
author: Cindy E.

description:
I sit here before you, or my computer, not as a woman with self control, not as a human who knows the limits of their strength, but as merely a human who has had their first old fashioned donut.  I sit here before the window to my virtual community, humbled by the grandeur of the simple fried dough, the elegance of the maple glaze, and the seduction of that initial crunch.  

After an arduous afternoon kicking Val's butt all over golden gate park with humiliating calistetics, outdoor biometrics, and feats of coordination that rival the Beijing Olympics, we deserved our donuts.  And I never do things in halves, so, I got 1/2 a dozen.  This way, I step out of my comfort zone, I try new things and I can grow as a human being.

Today, not yet 24 hours after above mentioned purchase, I have consumed them all.  Yes, Val helped me with some of them.  But I know that I ate 2 by myself between the hours of 10pm last night and 9:30am today.  And the rest somehow jumped down my throat prior to that.  

This morning, as I shamefully brushed the crumbs of sugar, maple glaze, chocolate and cake off my face, I got a glance at the double chin making it's presence known.  Oh donuts.  I have to quit you before it's too late.  You're no good for me.  I need to get back to the other obsessions, even french fries are more self regulating than you, evil delicious dough.
author: Christina C.

description: Yum! Best donuts I've had in SF so far. Always fluffy fresh cheap and delicious donuts! The apple fritter is really good too. Stop by this place too often.
author: Nina M.

description:
Ode to Donut World:

How how delicious your donuts be
the thought of your Apple Fritters fills me with glee

Open early morning, noon and late night,
even your Donut holes are filled with delight!

Old Fashn'd, Bttrmilk Loaves and Twsties too
whenever i can't have them, i certainly feel blue

An unassuming place across from the N
Tiz a great place for meeting friends!

Bob's, Allstar, Silver Cafe are also great places
but DWorld puts a hand in all yo faces

Cheaper, more convenient and overall better
They have 'donut shop' down to the letter

So Thank You Donut World for being there
keep makin' your nomnoms with tender love and care!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with Donut World.

I love how perfect the donuts are. I love that it is on my corner. I love that it has a classic, no frills, feel to it.

But I hate that it is open 24 hours a day and always seems like a great idea when the N-Owl drops me off after a long night on the town. 

Thanks for being so tempting and irresistible Donut World.
author: Kevin B.

description:
The best damn donuts in the city is just off the N-Judah. It is an entire world of donuts, as the name implies. Ok maybe it's not that big, but it's open 24 hours and is always fresh. Don't know how they do it but whether I walk in at 8 am, 3pm, or 2 am, always fresh and super tasty donuts.

Any old fashioned donuts, iced and sprinkled, bars, twists, and of course they're phenomenal apple fritters. Good people and clean eating/bus waiting area.

This place is a Sunset district treasure.
author: Ala T.

description: Decent, classic 24 hr donut place- the only one (I think) in the 'hood. They always have my faves in stock and the cashiers are always friendly. It's not ~hip or ~cute inside, but it's your standard old school shop. They sell milk and other cold drinks. Their coffee is pretty bad though. I suggest walking down the block to the beanery for a cup.
author: Rocio G.

description: I came here several times for donuts on my Saturday morning routines. The staff are really nice and their donuts are delicious!!!!!
author: Allie Y.

description:
This is why Inner Sunset decidedly beats the WP in the neighborhood wars: 24 hour food.  Ok, it's just donuts, but isn't there some comfort knowing this place will always be open, whether you're coming back from bars or heading for some 6 AM flight?

Trouble is, it only works if they actually have donuts at all hours (and preferably a decent selection).  We snagged some of the last remaining specimens at 10:30 PM, and by 12:30 they were completely out.  Maybe they were gearing up for the 2 AM rush, but still, when a donut shop has no donuts, it's time to close.  Ergo, if they are going to be always open, there must ALWAYS BE DONUTS.  Gotta work on that.  

If you do see donuts in there, go for it: they were surprisingly fresh and delicious, especially the crumb cake ones.
author: Wes M.

description: we always stop by here on our walk home after a good night with friends, and Donut World has not let us down. It may be that we have drunken munchies but it's so0o good, never tried them sober tho.. the apple bear claw or the apple fritter *drool* so good!
author: Lily S.

description:
Every proper San Francisco neighborhood needs a 24-hour doughnut shop. This one in particular is a beacon of hope amid the often-foggy, sometimes desolate late-night Inner Sunset offerings if you need a reliable, no-nonsense cup of coffee and a warm doughnut or pastry. And it's right on the corner of 9th and Judah, where you can hop on or off the N-Judah.

The shop at night is warmly-lit, populated by a few stragglers. In the day, it's an overlooked haven for a quiet place to catch up on reading while enjoying a morning/afternoon sweet nosh. It has an old-fashioned cafe/diner feel that is unpretentious and really kind of charming. 

No significant variation from traditional doughnut and coffee offerings, but if you're looking for the cream -- it's in the fridge to the right of the coffee post.
author: Robin L.

description: I always see this place while waiting for the N Judah by 9th, but never bothered to stop by.  One day, a co-worker of mine shared with me a piece of an apple fritter she had gotten from this place and I recall it being really good, so I decided to stop by today to get one.  I got here right before 3:30pm and there was only 1 person sitting in here at that time.  Their apple fritters are HUGE!  They're $1.70 each and around 6-7" diameter so this would be great to split with someone, or you could just eat the rest for another day.  It's slightly soft/moist on the inside and has a bit of crisp on the outside with some small pieces of apples.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
1st visit - boston creme donut - HUGE and delicious
2nd visit - cake donut with sprinkles - melted in my mouth

All donuts priced according to size and complexity, staff is always friendly, tables clean, donuts delicious and the best part - all products are clearly labeled with prices. 

my guilty pleasure
author: Kelly H.

description:
Been here once, and it was great. $0.90 for regular donuts aren't that bad!

So it was a really windy day and it was freezing.  I didn't want to wait outside in the cold for the N to come, so I decided to take a look at the place. First of all, it was empty, until some dude popped out of the back. And when i requested for 2 donuts, the man immediatly got it.  First bite, it was soft, and sweet, just the way i like it. Wolfed down 2 of my donuts, and wished I haven't spent my money earlier.  Thing is is that it's cash only, so thats a bummer. Hopefully i can come here at least once a week and try other pastries.
author: Reginald W.

description:
Every time I end up taking the 66 bus home I always see this place. I wonder should I go in and pick something up? Should I just stare and wonder if I need to eat one sugary sweet item from this tempting donut shop?

I finally gave in after checking out prices at another donut shop on my way to work. The prices here look reasonable after what I saw yesterday morning. I had to get a cinnamon roll. After having not so great ones in a while I thought I'd treat myself to one. 

Oh it was oh so good this morning a day later after I had purchased it. I didn't even need to warm it up. Cold was fine by me. Donut holes are a sometimes treat. 12 for $1.50 is a deal from the place I saw in the morning which was only half as many for the same treat. 

I will always be back for more.
author: Jen C.

description:
Donut World is open 24 hours. 
The End.
author: Denise S.

description:
My hubbie was cravin' donuts so I decided to grab some from Donut World after reading about it on Yelp.  I luckily found parking as it was before 10.  The woman that was working in there was nice and greeted me.  I let another customer go before me so I could check out what was in the case.  I stuck to the first case and got the 12 for $8 deal.  I couldn't believe how cheap they were.
I told the lady while she was ringing me up how I read about their donuts on Yelp and all the good reviews.  She was a bit shy and just smiled to herself.
I rewarded myself with one when I got home, one with chocolate on top and almonds.  The donut was so light and tasty!  It wasn't overly sweet nor was the donut very cakey.  My husband devoured the plain ones and my little princess loved the sprinkles and chocolate ones.  We had them for a good handful of days and they were still fresh.  I would definitely go back here.
author: Kekumukula N.

description:
The place it great. 
1. Its your basic donut shop but not TOO dirty. 
2. Its open 24 hours so if Im leaving the bars I hit it up.
3. Croissants with ham and cheese are on point.
author: Raul V.

description:
This place is awesome. Cheap delicious donuts and fast, friendly service. Actually, the service there was from some kid who looked like she may have not been old enough to legally work, lol... so FAST service! :D

There is plenty of seating inside so it was a good place to sit for a bit and chill while eating delicious donuts. Ooh and open 24 hours - that is always a plus. 

I just love the CONVENIENCE of this place! 

P.S. The apple fritters are freaking huge and they have pieces of apple in them.
author: Anna V.

description: Hands down the best coffee I've had for $1.25.  They have a ton of flavors and I love that it is right by my work. It beats making your own coffee! I'm always tempted to get a tasty donut - but always try to overt my eyes and just say "1 large coffee please!"
author: Callie O.

description: Good donuts at 4am while im at work , dont mind if I do hehe , Columbian coffee was pretty nasty tho maybe next time ill try the hazelnut.
author: Rene L.

description:
It was 80 degrees + in  the city today! YAY!

So I got my chubby butt up, dressed, and ready for an adventure that I *hoped* would end in a sunburn. (It did, b-t-dubs, and I was stoked.) 

I walked from my place in the Parkside to this little donut HEAVEN in the Sunset. I know, wah, it's not even that far, but listen buddy... I said it was WARM, okay?

1. YOU GUYS. It was like, 1:30 P.M. when I got there, and the donuts tasted AMAZINGLY fresh. They are a 24/7 spot, so they make them allll day I'm sure, but damn. I used to live next to a Yum-Yum Donuts that is supposedly 24/7 too and if you party hard and stumble in at 2am with some serious diabetic warranting munchies, they got, maybe, a stale fritter. 

2. THEY HAVE FILLED DONUT HOLES. OK. WHAT? OK. (I didn't try them, I mean come on, I just had a really nice walk. I wanted a donut, not hella calories, okay?) BUT I WILL TRY THEM.

3. It's right off the N line. So, even if I DID fill up on sugary dough (I didn't) and I needed to go somewheres else (I did) I coulda just hopped on and drifted away. But, I walked. Hah.

So go! Make the trip!
author: Savannah P.

description:
24 hour? Yes
Delicious donuts? Yes
Sprinkles? YES!

I come here at least 3 times a week.
My only gripe is that it's cash only :/
author: Sean H.

description: Chocolate eclairs are the way to go, would have been four stars but the coffee was disappointing.  Stop by and grab a cup somewhere else in the neighborhood...there are plenty of decent places.
author: Austin M.

description:
If I had to compare Donut World to a person, I'd call it a bff. It's always there for you 24/7 and will make your troubles disappear...most of the time. I usually get the donut holes or old fashion donuts. I can' think of anything special about the donut holes but I do enjoy getting 12 of them for $1.50. As for the old fashion dounts, I love the dense cakey texture thats totally different from krispy kreme donuts. 

This bff does have some flaws though. It's pretty hard to get a fresh batch of donuts and they sometimes run out of donut holes! Also bums lounge around there late at night and can sometimes be annoying. One of them asked me where was the N judah stop even though you can see it from the freaken window.

Overall, I enjoy going to Donut World. It's a great place to wait for the N judah or for a date. Impress your girl by giving her a nice "ring." A donut ring that is!
author: Michael Y.

description:
This place has slowly grown on me, as it's the only donut place in the area. The donuts are pretty average, but when you need a donut, you NEED a donut. One thing that they have here that's interesting is the filled donut holes. Either custard or raspberry. They're almost perfect if you want just a little bite of donut. Ahhhhh, donut holes, the underappreciated donut treat. 

The old fashioned donuts here are pretty good. Chocolate, glazed, plain, or maple. They look so appetizing sitting there in their neat rows. The raised donuts are nothing to write home about. There is quite a variety of cake donuts, though, so you could buy a whole box of those and go nuts. The chocolate cake donuts don't really have that much chocolate flavor to them.

They have most beverages you would want to pair with a donut (milk, coffee, juice). Cash only.
author: Saunders C.

description: Visited in the morning.  I had a cup of coffee and two donuts: plain, and plain with icing and coconut flakes.  I really enjoyed both.  They were very fresh.  The coffee was good too.  I'll be back.
author: Edward B.

description: when i crave donuts...Donut World is my first spot
author: Andrew V.

description: Best kept secret in the Inner Sunset. Great donuts, but my favorite is the chocolate croissant. Sometimes after a night out, I go there to get a hot chocolate. Delicious! And the family who owns it is so friendly. And the best part- they're open 24 hours!!!
author: Kay S.

description:
LOVE this place!  Everytime we walk down to the whole 7'th and Irving area, I make sure we stop in and grab something - anything from here!  They have custard filled donut holes!  I mean, really.  How can it get any better?!  Classic, old school donut shops just cannot be beat, and they're it!  

If it's in that glass case, I've probably tried it - and loved it.  

Krsipy Kreme ain't got nothing on them!
author: ROB L.

description:
Like that guy below me said, this place is like a best friend. I live pretty close to Donut World so whenever i come back for the holidays i stop by here. Just like the Cobra Kai, I also enjoy the old fashion donuts and sometimes i mix it up with a custard filled donut or an apple fritter. 

The donuts are good, but it is hard to know when the fresh batches come out. The old fashion donuts are one of my favorites just because it reminds me of what my grandpa used to get. It has a thicker texture than a regular donut and also has a bit of a crunch in it. 

If you're looking for something that's open 24/7 and for something that's gonna raise your sugar levels a bit, check out Donut World.
author: robin w.

description:
The donuts here are delicious and huge.  I went late at night and they tasted fresh, which was nice.  This place is open 24 hours, which is ridiculous.

No complaints.  They're in a convenient location right off the N-Judah line.  I was in and out, no waiting in line, and on to the next one.  Bring cash, they don't accept cards.
author: Paz R.

description:
One of my 3 favorite destinations for apple fritters in the city. 

Fritters are consistently good and they are more likely to be sold out than to have stale ones on-hand. Tend to be crispy on the outside and bursting with gooey, oily deliciousness on the inside thanks to liberal use of vanilla. A low point, and my only real complaint is that they don't use enough of (or simply don't use) cinnamon. 

Also tried a glazed buttermilk, which had a satisfyingly thick and hearty consistency with a little bit of moistness towards the center. 

No comment on their classic donuts as I've never tried them.
author: Gene R.

description: Simple, classic donut place. Cheapest place to get a quick breakfast or late-night snack.
author: Nicholas R.

description: Delicious! My boyfriend and I were up late and craving something sugary. I stumbled upon Donut World on Yelp and since it's open 24 hours, we decided to run over and get some donuts. Best decision ever! The cake donuts are only .90 cents! Cheaper than a can of soda ($1). As soon as I took a bite, I was in heaven. Very delicious. Definitely going to be coming here much more often. :)
author: Kate B.

description: LOVED the donuts here!  They tasted fresh and home made, best kind of donuts!  Plus, they're inexpensive.
author: Poonam M.

description: If your looking for an awesome selection of fresh doughnuts then this is it!! DELISH! I needed to get my fix and they are good for it. Tasty, fresh and just what i was looking for.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Tried the apple fritter....I like how the outside is crispy and has a little sweet glazed crunch. But the inner part is not soft and lacks apple pieces like Bob's....

The cream filled donut holes taste like they would be generic, processed Costco ones...to be real.
author: Eryn K.

description:
Awww back when I used to live in the Sunset and I would wait for the N-Judah after riding the 43..id always find myself eating a donut at donut world! 

Its warmer inside, there are seats and the workers are nice. Eating a donut while waiting for your train is way better than standing outside in the cold. The N-Judah makes a giant turn outside which gives you plenty of time to dash out to jump into the train too! 

I like all their donuts, they have a lot to choose from and their jellied and bearclaws are good too!
author: Amy S.

description: Open 24 hours. Owners are nice. Donuts are good. What more can you want in a donut shop?
author: Tis T.

description: It's a standard donut shop. There aren't any special items. It is however open 24 hours and there is likely something somewhat fresh. I also I believe it's the only standard donut shop in the area. I've stopped here several times for either a French cruller or glazed donut. The owners have been extremely nice at any time of the day. Nothing wrong here, but nothing special either.
author: Rahil P.

description: Great family owned doughnut shop. The pastries aren't that great but the doughnuts are. If you go at 4 in the morning the doughnuts are so fresh they are still warm. Be advised its cash only!
author: Rachel D.

description: I go here at least once a week on my way to work for a little morning sugar rush. Even though it's 6:30 in the morning there is always at least one or two people here and that makes it nice. If I hurry and the N-Judah is running and the regular snail pace I can run in get a donut and run to Irving and just catch the train.
author: Justin S.

description: Good donuts great price :) Plus its 24 hours!! The people there are always nice and friendly. convenient place too :)
author: Katherine P.

description: Great donuts! Dirt cheap, and yummy like krispy kreme, only thicker consistency. Yum yum yum!
author: Emily H.

description:
Chocolate old fashioned donuts are my weakness. So when I was having the munchies at 2:30am, Donut World was my savior. The only shop for blocks to be open 24/7 too. I got 2 donuts for $1.50, and mmm... they were delectably moist and hit the spot. 

Now only if there was a 24 hour Donut/Pizza World. My after-partying cravings would be completely satisfied!
author: Connie C.

description:
A few confessions from Eric S.:
I can see and smell Donut World from my apartment on 8th and Judah.
Sometimes after a night out I lie to cabbies so they'll drop me at 9th...
I've eaten countless after-midnight donuts at this place.
The best is to ask what's freshest and get 2.
I've gotten some of my best learning on here with coffee and a donut.

They also have cheap coffee which attracts the neighborhood's less fortunate.  
They're always friendly here too.
I love Donut World.  So will you :)
author: Eric S.

description:
Open 24 hours, cash only.  

This is a classic donut shop, just up the street from Momentum Chiropractic.  I know, it's not the smartest thing in the world to grab a cup of coffee before an adjustment, but I was 1/2 hour early and I have been going by this shop for half a year now.  So it was large, and at 5:30 pm it was quiet.  All the expected donuts were there, perfectly executed classic recipes, as well as a variety of coffees.  I selected my favorites, a chocolate old-fashioned and a French roast.  Everything was exactly as I expected.  Despite the low traffic at this hour, the clerk was cheerful and patient.  I imagine they get a lot more customers between 2 am and 6 am.
author: David D.

description:
This is an awesome spot for donuts at anytime of the day, since they're open 24 hours! When you walk in you'll see all the donuts lined up and set in rows perfectly-- almost as if the lady behind the counter has OCD or something... There are alot of different flavors, including a huge section of coconut donuts, blah! lol My favs include the chocolate custard bar(of course) and the JELLY FILLED DONUT HOLES! How awesome is that? They also boast an impressive 7 different coffees, too... lol.

Whats annoying is there are homeless people that stand outside asking you for change, and i hate that awkward feeling... but hey-- 4 Stars!
author: Greg G.

description:
How can you NOT stop here for a donut after getting off the N Judah? It's allure is so hard to resist. Maybe that's why I'm fat. Hmmmm....
(thinking.hard.ouch)

The joint is open 24 hours a day.

The apple fritter is by far the best donut they make. 

This place rules.
author: Matthew M.

description:
I can't believe that me and my bf decide to find some local goodies @ 1 a.m.  Can anyone think???  

Well, what we did is .... we went on yelp and started searching and found the closest spot for FOOD.  good and not too pricy!!!  and our total came up with under $6.50 with hot coca @ midnight. CROISSANT is FRESH!!!  so GOOD!!!  We even got extra pastries for next morning for breakfast too......  WHAT A DEAL!!!  It's not true that they make hot fresh donut between 12-4a.m.  The donut is okay, but is obviously not FRESH N' HOT.  Service is ver plesantly friendly.
author: evelyn y.

description:
The first few  things I think about with donuts is: 

1) I hate them, Unhealthy, sugar for breakfast, no thanks
2) The vegan donut place in Seattle is really good though
3) For some odd reason I use to order Apple Fritters here while waiting to take the horrific nightmare that is the "N"

The Apple Fritter was so magical that you have to try it one morning. I would say it's worth venturing here just to see what I'm talkin' bout. It's frickiin' huge. 

But yeah, do it, Thank me later, but stay off the N' takes way too long to get anywhere.
author: Taj A.

description:
This place rules. They have a great selection of soda and different milks. If you go after midnight, there's almost always someone interesting or weird there. 

One time we saw RIDER STRONG there. Yeah, Shawn from Boy Meets World! Another time, we saw an acidic jew reading the Koran clutching a guitar case like he was that dude from Desperado. What's an acidic jew anyways? I'm pretty sure I spelt that wrong.
author: Steven H.

description:
DONUT WORLD!!!!!!
